meanings.definition: To lecture or speak publicly on a subject.
meanings.sent1: During the class presentation, the teacher will prelect about the solar system.
meanings.sent2: The professor will prelect on Shakespearean literature in the auditorium.
meanings.sent3: The parrot decided to prelect on the importance of sharing crackers.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl prelected to the young owlets about the dangers of the forest.
meanings.sent5: As the guest speaker began to prelect, the audience leaned in attentively.

meanings.definition: To deliver a lecture or discourse.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will prelect on the latest research findings at the conference.
meanings.sent2: She prelected passionately about environmental conservation to the students.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to prelect on the challenges of being a house cat.
meanings.sent4: The politician prelected to the crowd, promising positive changes for the community.
meanings.sent5: Her father used to prelect to her about the importance of hard work and dedication.
